title: Firefox Using High CPU and Memory After Latest Update-Need Help
content:
Hi Mozilla Support Team üëã,

After updating Firefox to the latest version (Windows 10, 64-bit), I‚Äôve noticed that it‚Äôs using a very high amount of CPU and memory even when only a few tabs are open.

Here are some details:

1.Firefox Version: 131.0.3 (64-bit)

2.OS: Windows 10 Pro (22H2)

3.Extensions Installed: uBlock Origin, Grammarly, Bitwarden

4.Problem: CPU usage jumps to 60‚Äì80% and memory usage exceeds 2 GB after 10‚Äì15 minutes of normal browsing.

Tried So Far:

1.Restarted Firefox in Troubleshoot Mode (no extensions).

2.Cleared cache and site data.

3.Disabled hardware acceleration.

4.Reinstalled Firefox completely.

5.Even after doing all that, the issue persists.

Is there a known issue in the latest build, or any additional steps I can take to troubleshoot and reduce Firefox‚Äôs resource usage?

Thank you so much for your help!

Best regards, David Robert.
creator: davidrobert0301234

title: New profile management feature and sync
content:
Hi, I do not understand the new profile management feature of Firefox and how it relates to sync. I am logged into my Mozilla account that syncs bookmarks, and I use the default profile that I renamed to "personal". When I switch to a newly created "work" profile, I am no longer signed in.

Will the new profiles "personal" and "work" be synced to my account once I log on to both? I am using Firefox on several PCs and I don't want to recreate profiles such as "personal" and "work" on all the PCs manually?

Thanks for a reply.

title: Mozila won't import my bookmarks
content:
Hello

So a funny story happened today, I used CC cleaner to help clean my PC now I have it set up so it does not touch Mozilla in anyway yet after an update those settings got wiped and when I used the program it wiped out everything I had in Mozilla, history, saved passwords, tabs, EVERYTHING.

The last time I made a backup to my bookmarks was 6 months ago, a lot has changed since then, I tried to use the restore function however those also got wiped out, so I decided to use the old bookmarks, yet it doesn't work, for some reason it tells me that it doesn't have any bookmark data in the file yet Chrome can read and import the bookmarks from the file, if I try importing stuff from Chrome it also comes up empty, as an experiment I made a new export from Mozilla and tried to import it and got the same error. I still have 2 bookmarks and those can't be deleted no matter what I do, I kept trying to delete them however they are stuck there no matter what I try. This laptop is a new one I got on the cheap after my laptop had a problem with it's hard drive, I made the backup right before the switch.

Does anyone have any ideas about what exactly happened and keeps happening?
creator: andrei_c888

title: Linux and Netflix limitation to 720p
content:
Hello there. Unfortunately, according to Netflix help pages, Firefox Linux is limited to 720p, unlike Windows or macOS version. Opera is the only linux browser allowed to stream Netflix at 1080p.

This is a Netflix side limitation because using a fake user-agent is a workaround.

I have reported this problem to Netflix, it appears to be a DRM limitation. My report to Netflix have been share with their tech team, but I doubt that leads to anywhere.

Question : why this limitation ? Is the Widewine codec implemented differently in linux version ? Is there a way to make Netflix change their rules from Firefox team ?
creator: anat.ole

title: Main Menu Bookmarks Access moved from Task Bar to "Side bar" without any desire of my wanting it that way
content:
Greetings,

For many years, I could easily access My most important Bookmarks, from a button, located to the right of the FireFox search bar. Over approx. the past ten days, not only did My "Add-ons" NoScript, & Malwarebytes, that were located further to the right of the "Bookmarks Button" disappear, but also the "Bookmarks Button".

I found my add-ons still listed via the Extensions-Add-ons tab, but,.... I could not move them back to my "Tool Bar", nor could I activate them. I tried many different ways to get NoScript & Malwarebytes back to the Tool Bar, & Truthfully, I can not remember how I got them returned to the Tool Bar.

Now here's the Major Problem,..... I had No Need to Access my "Bookmarks contained in the Main menu" during this time period, nor did I notice that the "Book Marks Button" was gone.

Several days ago, I had to retrieve Data contained in the "Book Mark Menu", & I was absolutely Shocked to see that it was gone! There is literally Eight Years of Personal Data, Research, & More in that "Book Mark Section".

I took off work, after completing a Job, since last thurs., & after doing a lot of Chaotic Searching, I found that somehow, for some reason, Firefox decided to move my Access to the Book Mark menu, to the "Library", without Any Notice Whatsoever!

I Absolutely do not care for where they are now, nor the fact, that I have to go through a longer process just to Access them.

How do I return My "Book Marks Button" back to the Firefox Tool Bar?
creator: DavidDeBord
